DataElement.preferredName: Ejection Fraction Radionuclide Ventriculogram Scan Assessment Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no question that asks whether there was an assessment of the ejection fraction, a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction, by radionuclide ventriculogram, a multi-gated acquisition (MUGA) scan and a form of radionuclide imaging that provides a comprehensive look at blood flow and the function of the lower chambers of the heart ventricles.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Ejection Fraction Radionuclide Ventriculogram Scan Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the assessment of the ejection fraction, a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction, by radionuclide ventriculogram, a multi-gated acquisition (MUGA) scan and a form of radionuclide imaging that provides a comprehensive look at blood flow and the function of the lower chambers of the heart ventricles.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The ejection fraction (or, more correctly, left-ventricular ejection fraction, often abbreviated LVEF) is a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber. (Wikipedia)

Concepts.longName: Measurement of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction
Concepts.definition: A measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber.

Property.preferredDefinition: A multi-gated acquisition (MUGA) scan and a form of radionuclide imaging that provides a comprehensive look at blood flow and the function of the lower chambers of the heart ventricles.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic test used to evaluate the pumping function of the heart's ventricles. A radioactive tracer is injected into a vein and a gamma camera detects the radiation released by the tracer, with image acquisition triggered (gated) at different points of the cardiac cycle.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
